SEARCH
Package com.statistics.analysis

Class AdvancedStats

java.lang.Object
com.statistics.analysis.AdvancedStats
public class AdvancedStats extends Object
Provides advanced statistical calculations based on data stored in a Red-Black Tree structure. This class builds upon BasicStats functionality and implements various statistical methods for hypothesis testing, probability distributions, and confidence intervals.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AdvancedStats(RBTree tree)
    Constructs an AdvancedStats object using the provided Red-Black Tree data structure.

    • AdvancedStats

      public AdvancedStats(RBTree tree)
      Constructs an AdvancedStats object using the provided Red-Black Tree data structure.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • tScore

      public double tScore(double populationMean)
      Calculates the t-score (t-statistic) for the data against a known population mean. Used for determining if sample mean differs significantly from the population mean.
      Parameters:
      populationMean - The known mean of the population to test against
      Returns:
      The t-score representing the standardized difference

    • zScore

      public double zScore(double number)
      Computes the z-score (standard score) for a given value within the data distribution. Represents how many standard deviations a value is from the mean.
      Parameters:
      number - The value to calculate the z-score for
      Returns:
      The z-score (number of standard deviations from the mean)

    • normPDF

      public double normPDF(double number)
      Calculates the probability density function (PDF) value for a normal distribution based on the dataset's mean and standard deviation.
      Parameters:
      number - The point at which to evaluate the PDF
      Returns:
      The probability density at the given point

    • normCDF

      public double normCDF(double number)
      Calculates the cumulative distribution function (CDF) value for a normal distribution based on the dataset's mean and standard deviation.
      Parameters:
      number - The point up to which to calculate the cumulative probability
      Returns:
      The probability that a random variable is less than or equal to the given number

    • errorFunction

      public double errorFunction(double x)
      Calculates the error function (erf) using the Abramowitz and Stegun approximation. This implementation provides a balance between accuracy and computational efficiency.
      Parameters:
      x - The input value
      Returns:
      The error function value at x, with accuracy invalid input: '<' 1.5×10^-7

    • invNorm

      public double invNorm(double p, double mean, double stddev)
      Implements the inverse normal cumulative distribution function (quantile function) using a rational approximation algorithm for computational efficiency.
      Parameters:
      p - The probability value (0 invalid input: '<' p invalid input: '<' 1)
      mean - The mean of the desired normal distribution
      stddev - The standard deviation of the desired normal distribution
      Returns:
      The value x such that P(X ≤ x) = p for a normal random variable X

    • zInterval

      public double[] zInterval(double cLevel, double mean, double stddev)
      Calculates a confidence interval for the mean using z-distribution. For large sample sizes, the z-distribution closely approximates the t-distribution. This method includes performance optimizations for common confidence levels.
      Parameters:
      cLevel - The confidence level (between 0 and 1, e.g., 0.95 for 95% confidence)
      mean - The sample mean
      stddev - The sample standard deviation
      Returns:
      An array containing the lower and upper bounds of the confidence interval
